Demurrer.definition: a plea in response to an allegation
Demurrer.origin: [Anglo-French, from demurrer to file a demurrer, literally, to stay, dwell, delay, from Old French demorer , from Latin demorari to delay]

demurrer to the evidence.definition: a demurrer that asserts that the evidence is not sufficient to create a question of fact for the jury to decide

general demurrer.definition: a demurrer that challenges the sufficiency of the substance of allegation

special demurrer.definition: a demurrer that challenges the structure or form of an allegation as uncertain or ambiguous
special demurrer.note: A special demurrer must specify the defect in the allegation.
